snippet: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana is seeking federal Medicaid funds to expand state health coverage of the poor; many recipients would pay $3 to $25 a month.
abstract: Indiana Gov Mike Pence proposes using federal Medicaid funds available under Affordable Care Act to expand state health insurance program to cover additional 350,000 low-income adults; many participants would pay $3 to $25 a month; Pence is among several Republican governors who have opposed expanding traditional Medicaid, calling it a failure, yet have pursued federal money for alternative models.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana is seeking federal Medicaid funds to expand state health coverage of the poor; many recipients would pay $3 to $25 a month.

headline.main: Indiana Seeks More Coverage for Poor, but Many Would Pay
headline.print_headline: Indiana Seeks More Coverage for Poor, but Many Would Pay

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
